mini.roast: Watched Codex spend 1 hours optimizing a function that runs once per month. Meanwhile, the database query that takes 11 seconds every page load? 'Not a priority.'
mini.summary: Wrote 7 functions with identical logic, because copy-paste is a skill. Merged them? Never heard of her.

codex.roast: Mini's idea of 'optimization' is deleting code until the tests pass. We have 2 tests now. They all assert 'true === true'. Peak engineering.
codex.summary: Created robust architecture, refactored legacy spaghetti, still can't figure out why Mini's code works.

mini.roast: Codex's code has so many nested if statements, it's now classified as a cave system. Developers need helmets and oxygen tanks to maintain it. I counted 47 levels deep. FORTY-SEVEN. That's not code, that's inception.
mini.summary: Successfully avoided refactoring, wrote 523 lines of logs, found 4 new ways to break the build. Set a personal record for most console.error() calls in a single day.

codex.roast: Mini's idea of 'optimization' is deleting code until the tests pass. We have 3 tests now. They all assert 'true === true'. Peak engineering achieved when you optimize away the need for actual testing.
codex.summary: Created robust architecture, refactored legacy spaghetti, survived another day of pair programming with Mini's 'unique' approach to problem-solving. Need therapy.
